intro: Centropogon pinguis, commonly known as the fatstem centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
